required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: In Vivo Confocal Microscopic Analysis of Corneal Nerve Changes After ProKera Slim® for Dry Eye
clinical_study.official_title: In Vivo Confocal Microscopic Analysis of Corneal Nerve Changes After ProKera Slim® for Dry Eye

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective controlled pilot study to compare the outcome of ProKera® (PK) and conventional treatment in patients with moderate to severe Dry Eye Disease (DED)

primary_outcome.measure: Short-term efficacy in terms of corneal nerve regeneration
Short-term efficacy in terms of ocular surface integrity
primary_outcome.description: Assessed by in vivo confocal microscopy

primary_outcome.measure: Short-term efficacy in terms of corneal sensitivity
Short-term efficacy in terms of ocular clinical symptoms
primary_outcome.description: Assessed by SPEED questionnaire, pain score, and dry eye workshop grading

secondary_outcome.measure: Long-term efficacy in terms of corneal nerve regeneration
Long-term efficacy in terms of ocular surface integrity
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed by in vivo confocal microscopy

secondary_outcome.measure: Long-term efficacy in terms of corneal sensitivity
Long-term efficacy in terms of ocular clinical symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed by SPEED questionnaire, pain score, and dry eye workshop grading

intervention.description: subjects will receive cryopreserved amniotic membrane

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with moderate to severe DED (Grade 2-4 DEWS)
- Age range: 21 years and older.
- Both genders and all ethnic groups comparable with the local community.
- Subjects able to understand and willing to sign a written informed consent.
- Subjects able and willing to cooperate with investigational plan.
- Subjects able and willing to complete postoperative follow-up.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Symblepharon or lid abnormality preventing ProKera placement.
- Ocular infection within 14 days prior to study entry.
- Active ocular allergies.
- Previous ocular surgery or injury within 3 months before enrollment.
- Previous brain surgery, or Trigeminal nerve damage.
- Other conditions that may affect corneal nerves such as diabetes, thyroid disorders.
- Contact lens wearers.
- Pregnancy or subject expecting to be pregnant.
- Inability or unwillingness of subject to give written informed consent.
- Subjects with known intolerance to PK.
- Subjects use concomitant therapy that affects tear functions or ocular surface integrity.
- Subjects currently engaged in another clinical trial.
